questions.question: Which of these is the best definition of the ‘economic problem’?

choices.answer: People do not have enough money.
There are not enough resources to satisfy people’s wants.
There are too many factors of production.

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a factor ofproduction?
Division of labour can be defined as:

choices.answer: Workers specialise on just one task and become better at it.
Workers become specialist in all jobs.
All firms only have one worker
No workers are employed as machines always do all the work.

questions.question: One of the drawbacks to division of labour is that:

choices.answer: workers spend time on training to do several different jobs
workers can become bored through concentrating on one job
no machinery is used and this slows down production.

questions.question: All of the following are common business objectives (aims) except:
Which of the following is NOT one of the benefits of business growth?

choices.answer: The business will probably become more secure.
Management will have less work to do.

questions.question: Which stakeholders in a business are paid a salary by the business and lead and direct it?
The main objective of a newly formed business is most likely to be:

choices.answer: providing a service to the community
